moves.1. e4:
hello everyone, today I will annotate I game I just finished against a lower rated player. Unfortunately for me, I challenged this player when I was still 1200, but the game was finished when I was 1700, so I lost rating points for winning. However, I will try to illustrate some points about my opponent's play: HE played pretty well for a 1200.

So, my opponent plays e4. Here, I was going to try and play an open sicilian. I would not do this against a more experienced player, because I play open sicilians badly(theory, theory, theory) and prefer closed or alapin variations.
moves.2. Nf3: now we can go into an open sicilian
moves.2... Nc6: I will play the accelerated dragon.
moves.3. Nc3: I don't know this variation, if it is one, but I'll just stick to the accellerated setup.
moves.3... g6 4. a3: This is a waste of time. Instead, white should try developing faster/
moves.4... Bg7 5. Bc4: My opponent probobly doesn't know this line, and he's just sticking to principles:develop
moves.7... a6 8. Bg5 Bg4 9. Qd2: Well, now I chose to ruin his pawn structure, but give him an open g file.  I played this mainly becuase I see a  follow up on move 10, which allows me, I think to improve my position.
moves.9... Bxf3 10. gxf3 Nd4: this move strikes at the f3 pawn, and my N is well placed. If Kg2, then the rook will be hard to activate on the g file.
moves.11. Qf4: he leaves his c pawn undefended, but I don't have to chop it immediately.
moves.11... b5: Here, I thought at the time,  Bb3 was correct, averting material loss. My analysis may be correct or not, but my opponent played a move that allowed me to win material
moves.12. Bxf6 Bxf6 13. Bd5: this strikes at my rook, but I can counterattack
moves.13... b4: this was the key move I calculated, winning 2 pieces for a rook
moves.14. Bxa8 Qxa8: now  his N on c3 is attacked. Why not move it? 15.Nd5? Ne2+. You can calculate the rest.
moves.15. axb4: he opens the a file, and my a pawn is weak.
moves.15... cxb4: His knight is, in a way, pinned, because it can't move without dropping the queen.
moves.16. Qg4: I also had to make sure he couldn't play Rxa6 or something, then checkmating me. However, my queen can multitask without being overloaded.
moves.16... bxc3 17. bxc3 Ne2+: now I get a strong place for my knight.
moves.18. Kg2 Nxc3: I am clearly better, and this is enough to win.
moves.19. Ra3 Nb5: I need to prepare Nc7, even though it is passive, I need protection of the a pawn to keep the a file closed to castle
moves.20. Ra5 O-O 21. c4 Nc7: now that my weaknesses are covered, I can drive his pieces back, improve my own pieces, and attack with my extra force.
moves.25. Rxa6 Qb3: while material lis equal for now, it won't be for long.
moves.26. Ra8+ Kg7 27. Qe8: My king is in minimal danger
moves.27... Qxd3: White's king is actually in mmore danger
moves.28. Qg8+ Kh6 29. Ra4 Nd4 30. Ra2: a mistake, now he will be in big trouble.
moves.30... Qxf3+ 31. Kf1: A fine move, as he was going to suffer a very long and agonizing loss. Better get it over quickly.
